Nexus of Innovation

Leverage our ecosystem of creative thinkers and makers for your research and development needs.

Innovation is the engine that powers the U.S. economy and culture of entrepreneurship. Our framework for promoting market-based breakthroughs is firmly rooted in research, education, and intellectual property protection. The innovation environment in the United States is a wellspring of opportunities. It offers a competitive edge to the business community and contributes to its sustainable growth and success.

Research and Development

The United States is a global leader in research and development (R&D) with more than 31 percent of the world’s R&D spending across multiple industries. Robust funding of research activity – both public and private – positions the United States among the top ten global innovators. We are home to world-class research initiatives in science, technology, and energy. Our R&D integrated model spurs the pace of innovation and facilitates bringing new products to market.

University Partnerships

Our university and college system is highly regarded internationally: 16 of the top 20 universities in the world are located in the United States. Our leading research institutions play an important role in innovation and entrepreneurship. New technologies and techniques are often developed in our universities campuses and then expanded upon in the private sector and business communities.

Advanced Manufacturing

The U.S. manufacturing sector is constantly accelerating and innovating to meet global demands. Our cutting-edge technologies, strong innovation performance, and efficient processes are reflected in our manufacturing output: the second highest in the world. A federally-run network of manufacturing institutes offers companies a number of sector-focused spaces for public-private collaboration and manufacturing innovation.

Intellectual Property Protection

The United States is the world leader in intellectual property rights (IPR). The U.S. Patent and Trademark Office receives over a million new applications each year. Promoting the progress of new inventions and protecting the rights of their creators are core mandates of the U.S. government. We recognize that the vitality of the U.S. economy depends on our ability to protect new ideas and innovations simple and cost-effective ways.

Advanced Manufacturing
